title: M2M Reporting 2025
description:
Description
Business Initiative
Description of the Measure
M2M Reporting & Analyticsis used as integral part of the customer connectivity product and business-critical tool for IoT business to provide customers/management/internal users reports/analyzes and
(a) as a customer I would like to get business insights to monitor my business so that I can optimize my IoT projects that includes:
AI-supported reporting
Customer API
Customer self-service reporting
Ad-hoc reporting and analyses of huge reports
Single sign-on functionality across the entire IoT landscape, including IoT reporting
(b) as a manager I would like to get business insights to monitor my business so that I can increase my IoT connectivity revenues
(c) as an internal user (PM/CM/Sales) I would like to get business insights based on AI-supported IoT reporting to monitor my business so that I can improve my products and selling
Business Value / Value Hypothesis
Konsequenz, falls die Anforderungen nicht umgesetzt werden:
DT IoT Connectivity business completely at risk / Connectivity revenue 2025 (IPF) 245 m€ for Standard & Tailor-Made (TMSP) business at risk
Revenue at risk (2025-2028): Standard + Tailor-Made revenue = 641,9 m€ at risk
Tailor-Made customers at risk, esp. contractually agreed: Mercedes, Tesla, ENBW, BMW, Deutsche Bahn, ... 
New Technology rollout at risk
  Strategic Contribution & Time Criticality
Erhöhung des jährlichen Umsatzes um mehr als 30% und mehr pro Jahr. Für 2025 ist ein Umsatz von 245 m€ vorgesehen. 
Konkurrenzfähig auf dem Markt gegenüber anderen Providern und dadurch eine jährliche Erhöhung der Kundenzahl um mehr als 30%.
Lieferung des Einzelverbindungsnachweises für die Kunden und Erfüllung dieser regulatorischen Anforderung.
Skalierbarkeit für M2M Reporting für die zukünftigen Anforderungen aus dem Markt und Migration auf die neue Cloud-basierte Plattform.
Unterstützung der Kunden im Rahmen der Usage- und Rechnungsvalidierungen.

Documentation: Reporting tool and the features are well-documented

MVP Scope & Akzeptanzkriterien
MVP Scope
(a) The standard reports and customer specific reports must work for each customer. Cockpit is not part of the MVP.
(b) The TDG systems receive data form BI4BS and the management specific report templates can be created and used to create the reports in BI4BS. 
(c) The internal reporting via universe can be done by internal users.
In Scope / Akzeptanzkriterien
Customers: Existing & new reports can be provided reliably via the infrastructure to the customer.
Management: Functionality can be used to assure/monitor/analyze DT IoT revenue/business, new deals for Standard & Tailor-Made connectivity can be closed.
Internal users: automized, self-service reporting can be used to monitor/optimize/analyze of products/offerings, and forecast delivery.
Out of Scope
Cockpit, Delivery of the reports via API, Graphical reports, Access into the BI4BS universe (self service reporting) for the external user

Business Scope:
Extensions to IoT reporting features to meet current and future customer requirements over all NatCos. Here are some important requirements that need to be implemented urgently:

- AI-based reporting
- Customer API
- Customer self-service reporting
- Ad-hoc reporting and execution of analyses
- Access to IoT reporting by sales MNOs and their customers
- Single sign-on functionality across the entire IoT landscape, including IoT reporting

- Delivery of customer/management/internal reports/analytics: the customer can manage and track its IoT devices and products (as contractually agreed), TDG and DTIoT internally for Monitoring of the business development and proper management , optimization of IoT products and sales activities.
